revision.comment: ([[c:GR|GR]]) [[c:COM:FR|File renamed]]: [[File:WW1 Nieuport 14 aircraft samf4u.jpg]] → [[File:WW1 Nieuport 14 aircraft.jpg]] [[c:COM:FR#reasons|File renaming criterion #5]]: To change a file name that would be a violation of [[c:Special:MyLanguage/C...
revision.text:
__NOTOC__ <!-- This article is a part of [[Wikipedia:WikiProject Aircraft]]. Please see [[Wikipedia:WikiProject Aircraft/page content]] for recommended layout. --> {|{{Infobox Aircraft Begin | name=Nieuport 14 | image=File:WW1 Nieuport 14 aircraft.jpg | caption= }}{{Infobox Aircraft Type | type=Reconnaissance aircraft | national origin=France | manufacturer=[[Nieuport]] | designer= | first flight=September 1915 | introduced=1916 | retired= | status= | primary user=''[[Aéronautique Militaire]]'' | number built=100 | developed from= | variants with their own articles= }} |} [[File:Nieuport 14.jpg|thumb|Nieuport 14]] The '''Nieuport 14''' was a military reconnaissance sesquiplane produced in France during the First World War. When the French Army deployed it in 1916, they found its performance inferior to what was called for in the original specification, and the type was quickly withdrawn from front-line service.<ref name="JEA">{{cite book |last= Taylor |first= Michael J. H. |title=Jane's Encyclopedia of Aviation |year=1989 |publisher=Studio Editions |location=London|page=697 }}</ref><ref name="IEA">{{cite book |title=The Illustrated Encyclopedia of Aircraft |publisher=Orbis Publishing|location=London|page=2598}}</ref>
Developed in response to an order by the ''[[Aéronautique Militaire]]'' in summer 1915, it was to have been a two-seat reconnaissance machine capable of making a flight of {{convert|180|km|nmi mi|abbr=on}} and back while carrying a load of bombs.<ref name="Hartmann">{{cite web |last=Hartmann |first=Gérard |title=Les Nieuport de la guerre |work=La Coupe Schneider et hydravions anciens/Dossiers historiques hydravions et moteurs |year=2006 |url=http://www.hydroretro.net/etudegh/les_nieuports_de_la_guerre.pdf |accessdate=2008-11-07|page=12}}</ref> Nieuport's design was based on the [[Nieuport 12]] reconnaissance aircraft, but had its fuselage stretched to balance out the single nose mounted Hispano-Suiza V-8 engine and its wingspan increased by the addition of an additional bay.<ref name="Hartmann" /><ref name="Sanger">{{cite book |last= Sanger |first= Ray |title=Nieuport Aircraft of World War One |year=2002 |publisher=Crowood |location=Ramsbury|pages=41-44, 71}}</ref>
Deliveries to three reconnaissance squadrons commenced in late 1916, replacing obsolete [[Voisin]] types. However, the Nieuport 14's sluggish performance became immediately apparent and these squadrons were re-equipped with [[Nieuport 17]]s only eighteen days later and re-deployed as fighter squadrons.<ref name="IEA" /> Production of the Nieuport 14 was halted,<ref name="Hartmann" /> and remaining machines were relegated to training duties once improvements had been made to their side-mounted radiators.<ref name="Sanger"/> These were followed into service by a dedicated trainer variant, the '''Nieuport 14 École''' with dual controls, a nosewheel to guard against nose-over accidents, and a rotary engine of lower power replacing the V-8 of the original design.<ref name="Sanger"/> It is possible that these airframes had been left over from the original abortive production attempt.<ref name="Sanger"/> When further refined, the trainer version became known as the '''Nieuport 82''', nicknamed ''Grosse Julie'' ("Big Julie"),<ref name="Sanger"/> and aside from service in France, examples were exported to Brazil and Japan. Further development would lead to the [[Nieuport 15]].
Three Nieuport 14s were modified for test purposes; one with cut-outs in its wings to improve visibility and fitted with a {{convert|180|hp|kW|abbr=on}} [[Lorraine-Dietrich 8A]] engine, another with a {{convert|150|hp|kW|abbr=on}} version of the Hispano-Suiza engine originally fitted, and a third with a {{convert|220|hp|kW|abbr=on}} Hispano-Suiza engine and a crescent-shaped wing.<ref name="Sanger"/> <!-- ==Development== --> <!-- ==Operational history== -->
==Variants== * '''Nieuport 14 A.2''' - service designation of reconnaissance aircraft * '''Nieuport 14 E.2''' - service designation of trainer * '''Nieuport 82 E.2''' - dedicated trainer version
==Operators== ;{{FRA}} *[[Aeronautique Militaire]] <!-- ==Units using this aircraft/Operators (choose)== -->

You MUST include one or the other here, or no specifications will show -->met
